congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the resolution, as amended, was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Condemning North Korea's development of multiple intercontinental ballistic missiles
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H. Res. 92, amended, condemning North Korea's development of multiple intercontinental ballistic missiles, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 398 yeas to 3 nays, Roll No. 209;

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill, as amended, was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: North Korea State Sponsor of Terrorism Designation Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 479, amended, to require a report on the designation of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea as a state sponsor of terrorism, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 394 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 210.

titleInfo.title: AMENDING THE VETERANS ACCESS, CHOICE, AND ACCOUNTABILITY ACT OF 2014

extension.searchTitle: AMENDING THE VETERANS ACCESS, CHOICE, AND ACCOUNTABILITY ACT OF 2014; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 57
OLD VESSELS EXEMPTION ACT--Continued; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 57

congVote.result: The bill (S. 89) was passed, as follows:
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: <P/>By 85 yeas to 12 nays (Vote No. 102), Senate passed S. 89, to amend title 46, United States Code, to exempt old vessels that only operate within inland waterways from the fire-retardant materials requirement if the owners of such vessels make annual structural alterations to at least 10 percent of the areas of the vessels that are not constructed of fire-retardant materials.
